Contributingïƒ

First off, thanks for taking the time to contribute! ğŸ‰ğŸ‘

The following is a set of guidelines for contributing to PCNtoolkit. These are mostly guidelines, not rules. Use your best judgment, and feel free to propose changes to this document in a pull request.

How Can I Contribute?ïƒ

Reporting Bugsïƒ

This section guides you through submitting a bug report. Following these guidelines helps maintainers and the community understand your report, reproduce the behavior, and find related reports.

Before Submitting A Bug Reportïƒ

  • Check the debugging guide

  • Check the FAQs on the forum for a list of common questions and problems

  • Ensure the bug is not already reported by searching on GitHub under Issues

How Do I Submit A Good Bug Report?ïƒ

Bugs are tracked as GitHub issues. Create an issue and provide the following information:

  • Use a clear and descriptive title for the issue to identify the problem

  • Describe the exact steps which reproduce the problem in as much detail as possible

  • Provide specific examples to demonstrate the steps. Include links to files or GitHub projects, or copy/pasteable snippets

Suggesting Enhancementsïƒ

This section guides you through submitting an enhancement suggestion, including completely new features and minor improvements to existing functionality.

How Do I Submit A Good Enhancement Suggestion?ïƒ

Enhancement suggestions are tracked as GitHub issues. Create an issue and provide the following information:

  • Use a clear and descriptive title for the issue to identify the suggestion

  • Provide a step-by-step description of the suggested enhancement in as much detail as possible

  • Provide specific examples to demonstrate the steps

Development Setupïƒ

  1. Fork the repo

  2. Clone your fork:

    git clone https://github.com/your-username/pcntoolkit.git

  3. Install development dependencies:

    pip install -e ".[dev]"

Styleguidesïƒ

Git Commit Messagesïƒ

  • Use the present tense (â€œAdd featureâ€ not â€œAdded featureâ€)

  • Use the imperative mood (â€œMove cursor toâ€¦â€ not â€œMoves cursor toâ€¦â€)

  • Limit the first line to 72 characters or less

  • Reference issues and pull requests liberally after the first line

Python Styleguideïƒ

All Python code must adhere to PEP 8, and we use autopep8 for automatic code formatting. Please see the autopep8 documentation for more details. The autopep8 settings can be found in setup.cfg.

Running Testsïƒ

pytest tests/

Additional Notesïƒ

Feel free to propose changes to this document in a pull request.
